text: Arctite crystals Arctite (Na2Ca4(PO4)3F) is a colourless mineral found in the Kola Peninsula northern Russia.Mineral Handbook It has a Mohs hardness of 5 and has a specific gravity of 3.13. Arctite is transparent with a vitreous lustre. Arctite has a perfect cleavage and a trigonal crystal system.Mindat.org It is also a naturally occurring antiperovskite.Arctite Supergroup on Mindat Common associates of arctite include aegirine, natisite, lomonosovite, umbite and thenardite. == References == *Webmineral data Category:Phosphate minerals Category:Trigonal minerals
title: Arctite
